intro: Atractocarpus cucumicarpus, commonly known as the cucumber tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The tree produces edible fruits that resemble cucumbers, hence its common name. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
